drift_details.expected: Build system configured for hatchling with src layout
drift_details.actual: Build system uses hatchling; packages=['src/async_crud_mcp'] uses src layout but [tool.hatch.build.targets.wheel] uses packages key, not src-layout auto-detect pattern

drift_details.expected: BootstrapDaemon class with running flag and mcp_process tracking
configure_logging() uses loguru with enqueue=True and rotation
drift_details.actual: File handler has enqueue=True and rotation='10 MB', retention=3 (int, not '7 days'). Console handler missing enqueue=True.

drift_details.expected: Signal handlers wrapped in try/except ValueError for Windows service compat
async run() method with main loop polling session state and config
drift_details.actual: async run() method present with polling loop

drift_details.expected: _load_settings() detects config file changes by mtime
_start_mcp_server() launches subprocess with stderr redirected to file (not PIPE)
drift_details.actual: stderr redirected to file, not PIPE

drift_details.expected: _stop_mcp_server() with graceful terminate and 5s timeout then kill
await logger.complete() in finally block for loguru drain (ADR-005)
Console handler only when running interactively (sys.stdout.isatty())
drift_details.actual: sys.stdout is not None and sys.stdout.isatty() check

drift_details.expected: DEFAULT_PORT aligned with spec target_project default_port=8422
drift_details.actual: DEFAULT_PORT = 8720 (docstring placeholder still has 8720, spec target is 8422)

drift_details.expected: get_config_dir(username) with service context fallback to ProgramData
find_available_port(start, end) scans for first available port
init_config() with force, port, host, interactive, username params
Typer fallback to input() for interactive prompts
drift_details.actual: HAS_TYPER check with fallback to input()

drift_details.expected: InstallerBase abstract class with install/uninstall/start/stop/status/list methods
drift_details.actual: InstallerBase ABC with all required methods
LaunchdInstaller has working implementation delegating to launchd_installer.sh
SystemdInstaller has working implementation delegating to systemd_installer.sh

drift_details.expected: get_installer() factory function selecting by sys.platform
start command sets daemon.enabled=true in config
stop command sets daemon.enabled=false in config
restart command cycles the enabled flag with wait

drift_details.actual: status command has --username and --all options but missing --json flag in signature
logs command exists but --follow (streaming) may not be implemented per spec

drift_details.expected: Logs checks ProgramData path for Windows service per-user logs
drift_details.actual: uses get_user_logs_dir() which points to ProgramData

drift_details.expected: All commands use config file mutation (ADR-003), not direct process control

drift_details.actual: Has --force, --port, --no-start but also --yes; missing enables daemon as separate step
Has --remove-config and --remove-logs but missing --keep-config and --keep-logs flags (opposite polarity)

drift_details.expected: Admin check and elevation for quick-install on Windows
Installs service, generates config, starts service, enables daemon
Uses Rich console for output with fallback
DaemonConfig pydantic BaseModel with enabled, host, port, transport, log_level, config_poll_seconds, session_poll_seconds, wait_for_session
drift_details.actual: All fields present plus extras (config_debounce_seconds, health_check_interval)

drift_details.expected: Settings class extending BaseSettings with env_prefix='ASYNC_CRUD_MCP_'
Settings.from_file(config_path) class method for per-user config loading
Port validation: ge=1024, le=65535 or null
drift_details.actual: Port Field(default=8720) - spec says default_port=8422 but code uses 8720

drift_details.expected: Server entry point callable via python -m async_crud_mcp.server
Port pre-flight check using socket.bind() before mcp.run() (ADR-012)
Health endpoint at /health returning status, version, uptime
drift_details.actual: health_tool() is MCP tool (not HTTP /health endpoint). Returns status+version+uptime but via MCP tool protocol not HTTP GET /health

drift_details.expected: SSE transport on localhost by default
drift_details.actual: transport='sse' from settings; server started with mcp.run() using FastMCP - not explicit SSE with raw localhost binding; transport from config

drift_details.expected: Logs security warning for non-localhost binding
Uses ONLY Python stdlib (no third-party imports)
drift_details.actual: Only stdlib imports at top level

drift_details.expected: Interactive menu when run without arguments (Install/Reinstall/Uninstall/Quit)
drift_details.actual: Uses argparse with subcommands; interactive menu present but structure differs

drift_details.expected: Preflight checks (Python version >= 3.10, disk space, permissions)
Downloads and installs uv package manager with pip fallback
drift_details.actual: Need to verify; may delegate to bootstrap_uv.py
Need to verify exact venv creation flags

drift_details.expected: Configures pywin32 DLLs for Windows Service (GAP-5)
drift_details.actual: Need to verify pywin32 DLL configuration step

drift_details.expected: Installs OS service via direct CreateService API (GAP-4)
drift_details.actual: bootstrap_service.install_service() used via CLI calls, not directly from installer.py stdlib-only code

drift_details.expected: --skip-logs option to skip log file age check

drift_details.actual: .venv/, venv/ present; dist/ and build/ present
Has Installation section but may not include setup.bat/setup.sh specific instructions
Missing detailed CLI command usage examples
Missing explicit two-layer architecture overview (daemon + MCP server)

stories.title: Align DEFAULT_PORT to 8422 across config_init.py and config.py
stories.description: The spec defines default_port=8422 for the async-crud-mcp target project, but both config_init.py and config.py use DEFAULT_PORT=8720. Update the default port constant and all references (docstrings, comments) to match the spec target.

acceptance_criteria.text: DEFAULT_PORT = 8422 in src/async_crud_mcp/daemon/config_init.py
DaemonConfig.port default = 8422 in src/async_crud_mcp/config.py
health.py port default updated from 8720 to 8422
Docstrings and inline comments referencing port 8720 updated to 8422
All existing tests pass after the port change

stories.title: Add --json flag to daemon status command and verify logs --follow
stories.description: The daemon_cmd.py status command is missing the --json output option required by spec (d20 AC-d20.4). Also verify and fix the logs command has all required options: --follow, --lines, --username, --user per spec d20 AC-d20.5.

acceptance_criteria.text: daemon status command has --json option that outputs raw JSON status
daemon logs command has --follow option for streaming log output
daemon logs command has --lines option to control number of lines
daemon logs command has --username option for per-user logs
daemon logs command has --user option (alias) for per-user logs
All commands confirmed to use config file mutation (ADR-003)

stories.title: Add --keep-config and --keep-logs flags to uninstall command
stories.description: The uninstall command in install_cmd.py uses --remove-config and --remove-logs flags but spec d23 requires both positive (--keep-config/--keep-logs) and negative (--remove-config/--remove-logs) flag variants. The install_cmd.quick_install should also set daemon.enabled=true after start.

acceptance_criteria.text: uninstall command has --keep-config flag (default behavior: keep config)
uninstall command has --remove-config flag (opt-in removal)
uninstall command has --keep-logs flag (default behavior: keep logs)
uninstall command has --remove-logs flag (opt-in removal)
Flags are mutually exclusive pairs per group

stories.title: Add HTTP /health endpoint to server.py
stories.description: The spec (d25 AC-d25.4) requires a proper HTTP /health endpoint returning status, version, and uptime. Currently server.py only exposes a health_tool() as an MCP tool. A dedicated HTTP /health route should be added so external health monitors and installers can check server health without MCP client setup.

acceptance_criteria.text: HTTP GET /health endpoint returns JSON with status, version, uptime fields
Health endpoint is accessible via plain HTTP (not MCP protocol)
Returns 200 OK for healthy status, 503 for unhealthy
scripts/test_server.py can check the HTTP /health endpoint

stories.title: Fix bootstrap_daemon configure_logging retention and add console enqueue
stories.description: configure_logging() in bootstrap_daemon.py uses retention=3 (int, 3 files) instead of '7 days' string retention per spec. The console handler is also missing enqueue=True for async safety (ADR-005).

acceptance_criteria.text: configure_logging() file handler uses retention='7 days' string format
configure_logging() console handler has enqueue=True for async safety
configure_logging() adds gz compression to file handler

stories.title: Verify and align installer.py pywin32 DLL config, venv creation, and CreateService flow
stories.description: scripts/installer.py needs deep verification that: (1) uv venv uses --managed-python flag (ADR-010), (2) pywin32 DLLs are configured for Windows Service context (GAP-5), (3) service installation calls the correct API chain. This is currently partial due to stdlib-only constraint and delegation pattern.

acceptance_criteria.text: installer.py creates venv using 'uv venv --managed-python' (ADR-010)
installer.py configures pywin32 DLLs via pywin32_postinstall.py or equivalent (GAP-5)
installer.py installs service by calling CLI bootstrap install (which uses CreateService API)
installer.py exits with 130 on keyboard interrupt/cancel
Interactive menu works without arguments: Install/Reinstall/Uninstall/Quit options

stories.title: Enhance README with CLI usage examples and two-layer architecture overview
stories.description: README.md (d87) is missing explicit CLI command usage examples and the two-layer architecture overview (daemon service + MCP server). The spec requires these sections for user onboarding.

acceptance_criteria.text: README contains Quick Install section showing setup.bat / setup.sh usage
README contains CLI usage examples for bootstrap, daemon, config subcommands
README contains Architecture section describing two-layer design (OS service + MCP server)
README describes per-user daemon model and multi-user support

All 7 ACs verified: get_active_sessions(), is_user_session_active(), Windows WTS, macOS /dev/console, Linux /run/user, ImportError handling, CLI __main__

AC verified: package initializer present

All 8 ACs verified: install with --force and --use-task-scheduler, uninstall with --username and --force, start with --username, stop with --username, status with --username and --json (visible in full file), list command, admin check, uses get_installer()
All 5 ACs verified: init with --force/--port/--no-interactive/--username, show with --username/--json, edit command, validate command, pydantic model validation via get_settings()

SystemdInstaller has fully working implementation delegating to systemd_installer.sh (spec expected NotImplementedError skeleton)
